And finally, remember, minting out is not the end, its the very beginning. Now is when the really hard works starts. Now is when you really need a solid top team around you to help and support you. Now is your chance to really shine and build a life long business.
#nftcommunity

Get this right and you'll have a loyal top community who will enjoy the ride with you. Get this wrong, and you may well be dead in the water after probably one of the best nights of your life. The #NFT space is a very fickle place. Too many new shiny #nfts coming along every day

take weeks / months. Not hours or days. Yes, folks will leave, no drama. The right folks will take their place. The key is the first 24-48 hours. When you are most tired, most exhausted, most excited and frankly may be totally overwhelmed by things. Be present, and communicate

plans, vision and why holders need to stay the course with you. You need to give a clear breakdown & timeline of things that are happening. People dont love vague or unclear. You need to take folks with you, to buy into you and the team. They need to understand that things

be patient, considerate and spend time answering all the questions. The culture of the community in discord is really important. You need to move the chat from.. wen lambo, delist, sweep the floor, why dumping, and non stop about the price, to a chat talking about the long term

dumped by the others. You dont need to panic, you just need to have a plan to communicate and you need a solid team of mods to answer folks. Yes, many of the questions will be the same, sorry, but thats discord channels for you, few read anything. But even so, the mods need to

please everyone. Those that have no clue will leave complaining its all shit. Let them go, You really dont want those folks anyways. You want the patient, those that get it, those that believe in you, the team, your vision and plans. They will come, they will buy up the nfts

and what they want to hear is the calming tones of the founders, team, mods to calm everyone down, communicate the next steps, communicate whats been done, whats about to get done, where the eth has gone, whats in development, and a timeline for things. This of course wont

The key is communication. The key is to have a solid team of mods, devs who can answer folks. I know its tough, I know you're all tired. I know your all super excited that you've just minted out, but its a fragile time, the community are anxious, excited, worried, nervous
